location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.A note on the cover states 'contains previous papers from 1918 transferred from English Office prior to 1918 with P.A. File A.8.'

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the back cover with 31; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 2-29; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file discusses the Bahrain Order in Council 1913 which owing to the First World War and other factors was not introduced formally in Bahrain until 1919. The file comprises reports written by the Political Agent at Bahrain (Clive Kirkpatrick Daly) in 1921 and 1922 regarding its implementation and includes statements on the number of criminal and civil cases being brought under the Order.Also included in the file are instructions from the Foreign and Political Department of the Government of India regarding the requirement to exhibit and publish Orders in Councils and amendments to them, in affected countries prior to their formal publication by the Foreign Office.
